Class Localizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Localizer

  • public class Localizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements Localisation methods to localize at specific times Different localization methods may be used depending on how inaccurate is the odometer at the time of localization and the known environment
    Author:
    Cedric

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void alphaLocalize(boolean origin)
      Localizes independently of any odometer variables
      void lineLocalize(double x, double y)
      this localizes around an intersection to work the robot needs to be pointing north
      void lineLocalizeNE()
      this is a precision localization at the origin
      void omegalineLocalizeNE()
      this is a precision localization at the shooting area

    • Method Detail

      • alphaLocalize

        public void alphaLocalize(boolean origin)
        Localizes independently of any odometer variables
        Parameters:
        origin - if true localization should be at the starting area, else it should be at the shooting area.

      • lineLocalize

        public void lineLocalize(double x,
                double y)
        this localizes around an intersection to work the robot needs to be pointing north
        Parameters:
        x - line directly east of the light sensor
        y - line directly north of the light sensor

      • lineLocalizeNE

        public void lineLocalizeNE()
        this is a precision localization at the origin

      • omegalineLocalizeNE

        public void omegalineLocalizeNE()
        this is a precision localization at the shooting area
